intro: Bossiaea divaricata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in heathlands and shrublands. It has narrow, leathery leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Bossiaea divaricata is also known for its ability to produce nectar, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds.
